intro: Acronia lopezii, commonly known as the Lopezia acronia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, where it has adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Acronia lopezii is often found in disturbed or open habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
